tit.cmt: 「Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Yukihito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Yukihito』に変更しました。理由は、「Arisugawanomiya（ハイフン（-）なし） Imperial Prince Yukihito」をGoogle検索した結果、『Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya （ハイフン挿入）Yukihito』の表記が殆んどでした。

sen.j: 有栖川宮幸仁親王（ありすがわのみやゆきひとしんのう 明暦2年3月15日 (旧暦)（1656年4月9日） - 元禄12年7月25日 (旧暦)（1699年8月20日））は、江戸時代の皇族。
sen.e: Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Yukihito (April 9, 1656 – August 20, 1699) was a member of the Imperial family in the Edo period.
Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Yukihito (April 9, 1656 – August 20, 1699) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: ・「Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Yukihito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Yukihito』に変更しました。 ・「the Imperial family in the Edo period」 ⇒ 『the Imperial family who lived in the Edo period』に修正しました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Yukihito (April 9, 1656 – August 20, 1699) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the Edo period.

sen.j: 後西天皇の第二皇子、母は清閑寺共綱の娘共子。
sen.e: He was the second imperial prince of the Emperor Gosai, and his mother was Tomoko, a daughter of Tomotsuna SEIKANJI,
He was the second son of the Emperor Gosai, and his mother was Tomoko who was a daughter of Tomotsuna SEIKANJI.
sen.cmt: ・「the second imperial prince」⇒ 『the second son』に校正しました。「天皇の第二皇子」の「皇子」は、英語での意味上は「prince」ではなく「son」と言う意味になると思います。・「and his mother was Tomoko, a daughter of Tomotsuna SEIKANJI,」 ⇒ 『and his mother was Tomoko who was a daughter of Tomotsuna SEIKANJI.』に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the second son of the Emperor Gosai, and his mother was Tomoko who was a daughter of Tomotsuna SEIKANJI.

sen.j: 子に有栖川宮正仁親王、幸子女王（東山天皇中宮、承秋門院）、尊統入道親王。
sen.e: His children were Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tadahito, Princess Yukiko (empress of the Emperor Higashiyama; Shoshumonin) and Imperial Prince Sonto Nyudo.
His children were Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Tadahito, Princess Yukiko (empress of the Emperor Higashiyama; Shoshumonin) and Imperial Prince Sonto Nyudo.
sen.cmt: ・「Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tadahito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Tadahito』に変更しました。
sen.e: His children were Imperial Prince Arisugawa-no-miya Tadahito, Princess Yukiko (empress of the Emperor Higashiyama; Shoshumonin) and Imperial Prince Sonto Nyudo.

sen.j: 有栖川宮家第三代当主。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Arisugawanomiya family.
He was the third family head of the Arisugawa-no-miya family.
sen.cmt: ・「the Arisugawanomiya family」 ⇒ 『the Arisugawa-no-miya family』 に変更しました。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Arisugawa-no-miya family.

sen.j: 寛文7年（1667年）に高松宮を継承、寛文12年に有栖川宮と宮号を変更した。
sen.e: He succeeded to the Takamatsu no Miya in 1667, and changed the Miyago (reigning name) to Arisugawa no Miya in 1672.
He succeeded to the Takamatsu-no-miya in 1667, and changed the Miyago (reigning name) to Arisugawa-no-miya in 1672.
sen.cmt: ・「Takamatsu no Miya」 ⇒ 『Takamatsu-no-miya』に変更しました。・「Arisugawa no Miya」 ⇒ 『Arisugawa-no-miya』に変更しました。
sen.e: He succeeded to the Takamatsu-no-miya in 1667, and changed the Miyago (reigning name) to Arisugawa-no-miya in 1672.

sen.j: 延宝8年（1680年）に将軍徳川家綱が継嗣のないまま死去した際に、大老酒井忠清に徳川将軍に擁立されたとする宮将軍擁立説がある（→将軍継嗣問題継嗣決定前に将軍が死去したケースを参照）。
sen.e: There is a Miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) theory that says he was enthroned as a Tokugawa Shogun by Tairo (chief minister) Tadakiyo SAKAI when the 4th Shogun Tokugawa Ietsuna died without an heir in 1680 (=> see "Problem of heir of Shogun," a case where a shogun died before the decision of an heir).

There is a Miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) theory that says he was enthroned as a Tokugawa Shogun by Tairo (chief minister) Tadakiyo SAKAI when the 4th Shogun Tokugawa Ietsuna died without an heir in 1680 (=> see "Problem of heir of Shogun," a case where a shogun died before the decision of an heir).

There is a Miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) theory that says he was enthroned as a Tokugawa Shogun by Tairo (chief minister) Tadakiyo SAKAI when the 4th Shogun Tokugawa Ietsuna died without an heir in 1680 (=> see "Problem of heir of Shogun," a case where a shogun died before the decision of an heir).
